posts.post_content:
The "if able" clause doesn't mean "subject to timing restrictions". If that were the case, then *nothing* could be cast this way, since you can't ordinarily cast a spell while an ability is resolving. It's like cards with suspend: You cast it when the card tells you to cast it, during your upkeep, even though most suspend cards aren't instants.  
  
I think the "if able" is just for the sake of cards which require a target for which there are no legal targets, and the like.  
  
The purpose of this isn't to lock down your opponent; it's to get out your own big expensive spells, hopefully more powerful than the spells your opponent is getting for free. And as a side benefit, it also screws over anyone with a lot of X cost spells, anyone with a lot of extra card drawing, and anyone with spells designed to be played reactively like counterspells.
posts.html:
The "if able" clause doesn't mean "subject to timing restrictions". If that were the case, then nothing could be cast this way, since you can't ordinarily cast a spell while an ability is resolving. It's like cards with suspend: You cast it when the card tells you to cast it, during your upkeep, even though most suspend cards aren't instants.

I think the "if able" is just for the sake of cards which require a target for which there are no legal targets, and the like.

The purpose of this isn't to lock down your opponent; it's to get out your own big expensive spells, hopefully more powerful than the spells your opponent is getting for free. And as a side benefit, it also screws over anyone with a lot of X cost spells, anyone with a lot of extra card drawing, and anyone with spells designed to be played reactively like counterspells.

posts.post_content:
There's nothing to complicated about this card. It looks kinda cool. Those of you who are confused, just need to remember the Golden Rule of Magic:  
  
'If a card breaks the rules, go with the card'  
  
So the card says you cast the card without paying it's cost... so you do, regardless of the normal timing restrictions. Of course, if a card has explicit timing restrictions 'Play ABC only when/during XYZ happens..' They cannot be casted with the ability and are remain exiled.  
  
The 'If able' clause refers to the above and if the card requires a specific target (IE a counter spell, a Doom blade) and there are no legal targets, then it also remains exiled.  
  
If a card has an 'X' in the cost; as normal, 'X' is 0.
posts.html:
There's nothing to complicated about this card. It looks kinda cool. Those of you who are confused, just need to remember the Golden Rule of Magic:

'If a card breaks the rules, go with the card'

So the card says you cast the card without paying it's cost... so you do, regardless of the normal timing restrictions. Of course, if a card has explicit timing restrictions 'Play ABC only when/during XYZ happens..' They cannot be casted with the ability and are remain exiled.

The 'If able' clause refers to the above and if the card requires a specific target (IE a counter spell, a Doom blade) and there are no legal targets, then it also remains exiled.

If a card has an 'X' in the cost; as normal, 'X' is 0.

posts.post_content: [Liliana Vess](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana Vess) seems made for this card, her +1 ability can help eliminate your opponents hand, while her -2 ability lets you search for whatever you want to cast! Use with cards like [Treasure Hunt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Treasure Hunt) that *'put cards into your hand'*, since you aren't *technically* drawing them, you still maintain a full hand!

posts.post_content: All spells must be cast regardless of instant, sorcery, enchantment, creature or planeswalker. The only ones that aren't are ones that don't have a valid target (ie: doom blade when there are no non black creatures, counterspells etc.) Xcost=0 but is still cast. Lands don't count as the land for that turn. Awesome combos include Treasure mage, palladium myr, grand architect all to get it out early, then alloy myr in case it's destroyed, Jace's archivist to empty everyone's hands because yours is the only deck built for topdeck freeplay, flashback is good ie: lingering souls, then drop chunky things like Brutalizer exarch, Sphinx of Uthuun, Sheldreod, Elesh norn, Omniscience, Tamiyo (or any other planes walker), Rune Scarred Demon, Contagion Engine, Army of Damned, Myr Superion, Spine of Ish Sah, Phyrexian Ingester, any titans, Birthing Pod, Volition Reins, Etc..
posts.html:
All spells must be cast regardless of instant, sorcery, enchantment, creature or planeswalker. The only ones that aren't are ones that don't have a valid target (ie: doom blade when there are no non black creatures, counterspells etc.) Xcost=0 but is still cast. Lands don't count as the land for that turn. Awesome combos include Treasure mage, palladium myr, grand architect all to get it out early, then alloy myr in case it's destroyed, Jace's archivist to empty everyone's hands because yours is the only deck built for topdeck freeplay, flashback is good ie: lingering souls, then drop chunky things like Brutalizer exarch, Sphinx of Uthuun, Sheldreod, Elesh norn, Omniscience, Tamiyo (or any other planes walker), Rune Scarred Demon, Contagion Engine, Army of Damned, Myr Superion, Spine of Ish Sah, Phyrexian Ingester, any titans, Birthing Pod, Volition Reins, Etc..
